commits.message: Fix wrong formatting string in ytools-info
Update nodes in configs
Switch to an online default representative

payload.description: Adam Stern's static breath hold table implemented in a simple command line tool
Adam Stern's static breath hold table implemented in a simple command line tool

issue.title: How should I deal with disconnected DAGs?
issue.body:
This is not necessarily a feature request, but I'm curious how you would deal with disconnected DAGs, or if this is outside the scope of this library. Currently the library does not enforce the graph to be connected, so I can have multiple disconnected DAGs within one DAG of the library. In this case some functions like `DAG.GetRoots` become less useful and there seems to be no way to find the roots of a specific vertex.

Do you think something like a `func (d *DAG) GetConnectedDAGs() []*DAG` or `func (d *DAG) GetConnectedDAG(id string) *DAG` or `func (d *DAG) DeleteDisconnected(id string)` or similar would be a good addition to the library?

pull_request.title: Allow uploading multiple files at once
pull_request.body: I often find myself wanting to upload multiple files in one go. This pull requests enables it.

repo.name: http-file-server
repo.description: tiny portable HTTP file server. single binary, no dependencies. linux, osx, windows. #golang

repo.name: http-file-server
repo.description: tiny portable HTTP file server. single binary, no dependencies. linux, osx, windows. #golang

commits.message: Allow uploading multiple files at once
Make the repository a Go module
Allow uploading without existing files

Merge pull request #5 from codesoap/gomod

Make the repository a Go module

Merge pull request #6 from codesoap/upload

Allow uploading without existing files
Release 1.6.1
Create LICENSE
add support to delete method
return forbidden if upload or delete are not allowed

Merge pull request #9 from AdvancedFarm/master

Add support for delete method

issue.title: Flag to Use Non-Default Node
issue.body:
Changing the node for atto can be a little weird to do. Recompiling just to change the node kind of limits atto in a few ways. Adding a `--node` flag would override the default node in [config.go](https://github.com/codesoap/atto/blob/master/cmd/atto/config.go) without recompiling it, or changing it forever.

Especially useful for periods of downtime;

    echo $SEED | atto --node "https://rainstorm.city/api" -a 0 balance

Check the balance of apex index from $SEED using the `rainstorm.city` node, overwriting the default `https://proxy.powernode.cc/proxy`.

I think it could be very useful. Any thoughts?

comment.body:
Hmm, I'm still not too convinced improving atto for this is necessary.

Can you elaborate on why you nodes go down so frequently? I feel like you have chosen a bad node, if it goes down so regularly, that you already have a go-to workaround for this.

issue.title: Flag to Use Non-Default Node
issue.body:
Changing the node for atto can be a little weird to do. Recompiling just to change the node kind of limits atto in a few ways. Adding a `--node` flag would override the default node in [config.go](https://github.com/codesoap/atto/blob/master/cmd/atto/config.go) without recompiling it, or changing it forever.

Especially useful for periods of downtime;

    echo $SEED | atto --node "https://rainstorm.city/api" -a 0 balance

Check the balance of apex index from $SEED using the `rainstorm.city` node, overwriting the default `https://proxy.powernode.cc/proxy`.

I think it could be very useful. Any thoughts?

comment.body:
Thanks for sharing your idea! Hardcoding config for things that shouldn't usually change is a design decision I took from the suckless community. I'm not yet convinced I should complicate the code to allow switching nodes, since this isn't something a regular user should have to do.

Could you elaborate a little bit on your use cases? Do you only do this when a server is down? In this case I would maybe consider putting a list of nodes into `config.go`; if one node fails to respond, the next would be used automatically.
